item.title: Keep It in the Family
item.itunes:title: Keep It in the Family
item.description:
Everything you are working on can be found in relation to your core group. Your family. But why is family such an important part of personal growth work? Buckle up!


Are You Ready To Unfuck Yourself For Good?

  1. If you want to be the first to know when we drop new episodes, please take a moment to Follow or Subscribe to Unfuck Nation wherever you listen to your favorite Podcasts.
  2. If you have a question for Gary that you’d like featured on an upcoming episode, you can click here to email him directly or leave us a voicemail on the Unfuck Nation Hotline at (646) 450-3203.
  3. If you’d like to show your support for the show, we would greatly appreciate it if you would share the show with a friend or write a review for the show on Apple Podcasts.
  4. For more of Gary’s content, you can click here to visit his website or you can connect with him on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.



Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: The Problem with Purpose
item.itunes:title: The Problem with Purpose
item.description:
There's so much effort put into "purpose" and knowing your "why" we can often get distracted or led down a pathway of overwhelm and confusion. This week, we get clear about who we are and what we are up to!


Are You Ready To Unfuck Yourself For Good?

item.title: What's the Story?
item.itunes:title: What's the Story?
item.itunes:subtitle: Everywhere you look in the personal development genre, there's a meme, an article, or a video that's trying to convince you to "re-write your story." But what is your story?
item.description:
Everywhere you look in the personal development genre, there's a meme, an article, or a video that's trying to convince you to "re-write your story."


The problem is, we have no real connection to what that means. What is YOUR story? How is it still playing out in your life and tying you to a future you don't even want? item.title: The Problem with Change
item.itunes:title: The Problem with Change
item.itunes:subtitle: Significant life change is great for you, but how does it impact those around you?
item.description:
There's a nature to changing your life, that is to say there are certain things that come with any significant life change. The problem is we often resist or try to avoid the baggage that comes with change, and we end up putting off the changes we so desperately want to make. So in this episode, Gary puts you firmly in the seat of what you need to prepare yourself for, to embrace a realistic approach to what your future holds and empower everything that you are up to! New body? New career? New city or business or partner? You need this episode!

item.title: Why You Are the Way You Are
item.itunes:title: Why You Are the Way You Are
item.itunes:subtitle: When you tell others, "I'm just being myself," are you really being your authentic self? Or is it perhaps another age old excuse that's hiding in plain sight?
item.description:
When you tell others, "I'm just being myself," are you really being your authentic self? Or is it perhaps another age old excuse that's hiding in plain sight? Unfortunately, sayings like these have become so culturally camouflaged and commonplace that they've distorted ontological perspectives as time has gone on. It's high time you cut this shit out - so on this episode, Gary's confronting the "you" that you say you are.

item.itunes:title: The War on Words - Doing My Best

item.title: Let's Get After It!
item.itunes:title: Let's Get After It!
item.itunes:subtitle: Whether you're experiencing growing pains or you're stuck at a plateau, don't you think it's high time you break through your self imposed barriers?
item.description:
Whether you're experiencing growing pains or you're stuck at a plateau, don't you think it's high time you break through your self imposed barriers? There are always moments when we feel the urge to make a change for ourselves, but it's incredibly common to tip toe around change-making actions. So, Gary's back on the mic to help you get real with yourself about what it takes to move the needle and - as usual - to answer some questions from the Nation! Here's what's on deck:


  • How should you confront the personal, professional, and environmental growing pains that come with developing yourself?
  • What can you do to persist through a difficult job transition when you're barely able to get your foot in the door?
  • How can I escape the fear of failure trap and the procrastination that comes with it?
  • Is there a practical way to process trauma and get over a fear of death?


If you're ready to take on the new year, all that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfu*k Nation with Gary John Bishop!


Are You Ready to Unfu*k Yourself for Good?

item.title: There is No "Hope"
item.itunes:title: There is No "Hope"
item.itunes:subtitle: Get ready to unfu*k the new year! Gary's carving up the annual tradition of making New Year's Resolutions.
item.description:
Don't be fooled, Gary's not going through an existential crisis. Quite to the contrary - he's carving up the annual tradition of making New Year's Resolutions to give you the keys to real, significant life change. That's right, we're unfu*king 2021! So, join Gary for a powerful exercise in creating the future you want, and find out his answers to these questions from the Nation:


  • Is the idea of finding your vocation valid or is it voodoo?
  • Should I focus my efforts on being great at one thing at a time, or can I find a way to multitask and win in all areas of my life?
  • How can I beat my anxiety when it comes to networking and forging new relationships?


If you're ready to take on the new year, all that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfu*k Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Winning at Life Without Losing Yourself
item.itunes:title: Winning at Life Without Losing Yourself
item.itunes:subtitle: All too often, we get so caught up trying to develop ourselves that we stop paying attention to those people and priorities in our lives that matter. But is there a better way?
item.description:
All too often, we get so caught up trying to develop ourselves that we stop paying attention to those people and priorities in our lives that matter. But is there a better way? Is there some balance we can find, or would that require making some deal with the devil? CUT IT OUT! Of course there's a way, just leave it to GJB to clear up how you can win at life without losing yourself, along with these great questions from the nation:


  • How can I unfuck myself from thinking that I'm making progress when - in reality - I'm not?
  • What is the difference between "putting up with something" and "enduring something"?
  • How can I recalibrate or recenter my response to positive and negative feedback?
  • Is there a way to manage the blowback or retaliation of others that sometimes comes from unfucking yourself?


All that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: You Can't Divorce Your Kids
item.itunes:title: You Can't Divorce Your Kids
item.itunes:subtitle: This one goes out to all the parents, the wanna-be parents, the soon-to-be parents, and even the helicopter parents. You might want to sit down for this one, because it's time to unfu*k parenting!
item.description:
Gary's been on a roll through these last few episodes! You've heard his insights on authenticity, relationships, and family - but this one goes out to all the parents, the wanna-be parents, the soon-to-be parents, and even the helicopter parents. You might want to sit down for this one, because on this episode, Gary's set his sights on parenting, the ways we regard our own parents, and answering these questions from the nation:


  • While I’m working on myself, what can I do to unfuck my child from oversensitivity?
  • Is it fucked up to use my child's future as a motivating factor?
  • How can I have a relationship with my kid when they resent me for getting divorced?
  • How should I weigh my own happiness against the happiness of others, including my children?


All that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Winning Them Back
item.itunes:title: Winning Them Back
item.itunes:subtitle: Even the most long-lived romantic relationships face their fair share of obstacles, b But when your love is tested, you need to be open to the idea that it might not be the relationship that needs to get unfu*ked!
item.description:
It's no secret - even the most long-lived romantic relationships face their fair share of obstacles. But when your love is tested, you need to be open to the idea that it might not be the relationship that needs to get unfu*ked... It might just be you! So turn up the volume, because GJB is back on the warpath to bring you for another riveting episode of Unfu*k Nation - this time, breaking down why it's time to stop working toward "winning them back," discussing how you can bring your best self to your relationships, and answering these big questions from listeners around the Nation:


  • How can I take ownership of my past relationship's faults and close this chapter of my life without dwelling in the past?
  • My husband had an affair, should I inform his the spouse of his mistress?
  • How can I overcome the fear that my partner might leave me? Is there a better way to manage insecurity in relationships?


All that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Family Failings
item.itunes:title: Family Failings
item.itunes:subtitle: While the global pandemic is likely forcing you to scale back the size of your cornucopia this Thanksgiving, the question remains: what sort of drama will your family be bringing to this year's festivities?
item.description:
Family is always the centerpiece of the Holiday Season. So, while the global pandemic is likely forcing you to scale back the size of your cornucopia this Thanksgiving, the question remains: what sort of drama will your family be bringing to this year's festivities? Well, before you get carried away with your carving knife, Gary's here with a fresh batch of insights to help you handle your Family Failings as we head into the Holidays. You won't want to miss a moment of the fun, so press 'Play' right now for Gary's answers to these big questions from the listeners:


  • Is there a way to self-diagnose a healthy or unhealthy way of showing love and appreciation for your tribe and your family?
  • How can I learn to forgive myself and others? 
  • How can I better tread the line between being a supportive parent and bulldozing my family as a helicopter parent?
  • When dealing with feeling like an outsider amongst extended family, how can I stop feeling like a victim?
  • What are your thankful for?


All families can work, so we hope you came hungry for answers! All that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

  • How can I learn to forgive myself and others? 
  • How can I better tread the line between being a supportive parent and bulldozing my family as a helicopter parent?
  • When dealing with feeling like an outsider amongst extended family, how can I stop feeling like a victim?
  • What are your thankful for?


All families can work, so we hope you came hungry for answers! All that and more is ahead on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Taking the Leap
item.itunes:title: Taking the Leap
item.itunes:subtitle: If you're someone who's interested in making a significant life change, strap in and get ready break free from the hamster wheel!
item.description:
If you're someone who's interested in making a significant life change, strap in and turn up the volume! On this episode, Gary's pulling the curtain back to reveal what you need to break free from your hamster wheel and how you can embrace the uncertainty on the other side of your leap of faith. You can have great thoughts and do great things! Take the leap and come join the nation for Gary's answers to these big questions:


  • I feel like I'm not measuring up to the challenge, so how can I get over the feeling of never being good enough?
  • Do you have any tips on dealing with Analysis Paralysis when it comes to risk aversion?
  • Is there a better way of availing opportunities that I'm missing?


So what're you waiting for? Leap into this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Your Truth is BS - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Your Truth is BS - Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: You'd be shocked if you knew how quickly "being authentic" can become "being an @$$hole," but here's the good news: it's not too late to stop doing that sh*t!
item.description:
In the eye-opening conclusion to last week's conversation about authenticity and speaking your truth - Gary's taking the nation straight to the heart of how your complaints bastardize the truth and take you from "being authentic" to "being an @$$hole." But that's just the beginning! Gary's going up against a lightning round of questions to show what authenticity is all about before capping things off with one HUGE question from the nation. It's another electrifying episode you won't want to miss, but if you need more reason to tune in right now, here's what Gary's unpacking this week:


  • What personal development practices or ideologies do you consider BS?
  • Are there any other books that you recommend checking out before cracking into Unfu*k Yourself, Stop Doing that Sh*t, or Wise as Fu*k?
  • Where are you finding hope during these challenging times?
  • What's the line that separates living as your authentic self from egotistical living? 


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Your Truth is BS - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Your Truth is BS - Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Everybody likes to think they're being authentic, but what would you say if Gary told you that "your truth" is bullshit?
item.description:
Everybody likes to think they're being authentic, but what would you say if Gary told you that "your truth" is bullshit? Well, hot on the heels of the release of Wise as Fu*k, Gary's taking on the grey area that separates concepts like authenticity, personality, and complaints. So, what's really going on in the background of your thoughts? What runs you as a human being? Is your truth really just bullsh*t? Joining the nation today and reveal what's true, including Gary's insights on these questions from your fellow listeners:


  • How can I best cope with feeling like I'm under someone's thumb?
  • Why am I so caught up in labeling my spirituality, and should I even give a shit?
  • How can I deal with my feelings of inadequacy?


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.itunes:subtitle: Join Gary in celebrating the release of his newest book, Wise as Fu*k! Take a special look into what it means to be wise in the four areas you need it most: love, loss, fear and success.
item.description:
In celebration of the release of his newest book - Wise as Fu*k - Gary's giving you a special look into what it means to be wise in the four areas you need it most: love, loss, fear and success. So, if you're ready to start putting your wisdom to work for you, join the nation for this must-hear episode and get Gary's perspective on these questions from your fellow listeners:


  • When it comes to relationships, I need to work on how I see and deal with others. How do I pick the right relationship to unfuck when most of my relationships seem like they're in good standing?
  • How do I connect with people who will truly show up for me in my life, and how can I show up for others?
  • What do you tell people who can't stop fucking up their own weightloss progress?


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!

item.title: Stop Fu*king Explaining Yourself!
item.itunes:title: Stop Fu*king Explaining Yourself!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Gary's laying out some fundamental truths behind why you need to stop spinning up stories and how your backstory is just another mechanism for you to make bullshit excuses.
item.description:
Everybody loves a good story, right? That's what many of us believe, but this week, Gary's laying out some fundamental truths behind why you need to stop spinning up stories and how your backstory is just another mechanism for you to make bullshit excuses. So, come join the nation and get your story straight with the help of Gary's insights on these big questions from our listeners:


  • How can I be a storyteller without getting caught up in the backstory?
  • How can I bridge the gap between setting context for myself when setting a goal without overcommitting to the backstory?
  • Is context another way of saying "living first with intention: and purpose? Will context help me set more purposeful goals?
  • I feel like I've got years of knowledge and nowhere to go with it. How can I rise above this?


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!


Are You Ready to Unfuck Yourself for Good?

item.title: Finding Closure and Getting Yourself Complete
item.itunes:title: Finding Closure and Getting Yourself Complete
item.itunes:subtitle: Is something holding you back? If you're looking to regain your freedom, you need to get yourself complete and find some closure!
item.description:
This week, Gary's taking on a real beast of a topic: CLOSURE. You know - all the things you're looking to be at peace with like resentment, relationship issues or even the most overwhelmingly unresolved shit you've got going on in your life. Get your freedom back and get Gary's insights on these big questions from the Nation:


  • After experiencing a breakup, how can I put myself back into the position where I was at the beginning of the relationship? In other words, how can I get her back after fucking up?
  • How do I prove or justify to others that the time I've spent working on myself was not only needed but worth it and not wasted?
  • How can I participate in a support group (like AA) without feeling like I've done something wrong? How can I get out of a shame cycle?


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!


Are You Ready to Unfuck Yourself for Good?

item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Gary's answering some juicy questions from his followers on Facebook and sharing some quick insight into his personal philosophy.
item.description:
So, now that you know what Unfuck Nation is all about, Gary's sharing some quick insight into his personal philosophy and getting right to the vegan meat on the bone... EMPOWERING YOU! This week, Gary's answering some of these juicy questions from his followers on Facebook.


  • Why bother trying when it all seems to fall apart?
  • How can I better manage or stop myself when it comes to worry?
  • Do you have any advice for someone who's trying to hold themselves accountable?
  • How do you avoid losing everyone when you're working on becoming the person you want to be?


All that and more on this episode of Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop!


Are You Ready to Unfuck Yourself for Good?

  1. If you want to be the first to know when we drop new episodes, please take a moment to Follow or Subscribe to Unfuck Nation wherever you listen to your favorite Podcasts.
  2. If you have a question for Gary that you'd like featured on an upcoming episode, you can click here to email him directly or leave us a voicemail on the Unfuck Nation Hotline at (646) 450-3203.
  3. If you'd like to show your support for the show, we would greatly appreciate it if you would share the show with a friend or write a review for the show on Apple Podcasts.
  4. For more of Gary's content, you can click here to visit his website or you can connect with him on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Welcome to the Nation!
item.itunes:title: Welcome to the Nation!
item.itunes:subtitle: Gary sets the stage for what's to come and sheds a little light on how this show's going to help you cut through your special brand of bullshit.
item.description:
Welcome to Unfuck Nation with Gary John Bishop! On this episode, Gary's setting the stage for what's to come and shedding a little light on how this show's going to help cut through your brand of bullshit. Oh, and just for good measure, he's giving you a primer on how to use this shows wisdom to take responsibility for your life.
